timeline.message: null handling for numeric first/last aggregators, refactor to not extend nullable numeric agg since they are complex typed aggs
initially null or not based on config

timeline.bodyText: Can you add javadocs for these buffer methods?
timeline.author: jon-wei

timeline.bodyText: nit: to follow the ordering in the buffer, maybe move putValue call after the null marker setting
timeline.author: jon-wei
jihoonson

replies.bodyText: switching these to use NullHandling.IS_NULL_BYTE and NullHandling.IS_NOT_NULL_BYTE
replies.author: clintropolis

timeline.bodyText: Byte.BYTES. Or perhaps adding a new variable NULL_SIZE?
timeline.author: jihoonson

replies.bodyText: it seems unlikely to me that the number of bytes in a byte is going to change, but ok :p
replies.author: clintropolis

timeline.message: review stuff, make string first/last consistent with null handling of numeric columns, more tests
handle nil selectors, revert to primitive first/last types so groupby v1 works...

timeline.bodyText: looks like this is missing unit tests? Also javadocs since this is a utility that would be used by many other classes
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText: This is covered by calcite query tests that order by the first/last aggregators; afaik SerializedPair is only used by first/last despite it's generic name, to store a timestamp and value.
replies.author: clintropolis

timeline.bodyText:
Nice abstraction! 🎉
note to self: can the get call be abstracted into the base class?
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText: Well, I guess that is going to happen anyway in making the pair.. so I guess maybe the on heap version of get could be shared, but not really possible for the buffer aggregator.
replies.author: clintropolis

timeline.bodyText: It took me a long time to try and figure out what the comparator was used for. I got wrapped up in the fact that the aggregator was meant compare timestamps, that I didn't realize this was for ordering. I think a javadoc on  #AggregatorFactory#getComparator would have cleared up my confusion pretty quickly
timeline.author: suneet-s

timeline.bodyText:
Based on javadocs in makeColumnValueSelector this selector can be NilColumnValueSelector
in which case selector.getObject() on line 170 would return null and line 171 would throw an NPE?
similar comment for the factorizeBuffered method
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText: Since this is for combining, the selector will be of the serialized pair complex objects, which will not be null.
replies.author: clintropolis

timeline.bodyText: it looks like these tests will only check useDefaultValuesForNull = true or is there some config I'm not seeing that sets it to false as well in another run?
timeline.author: suneet-s

replies.bodyText: travis runs tests in both modes, this is to let tests run in intellij which doesn't get initialized correctly
replies.author: clintropolis
